skill.name: chapter-outline-generator
skill.description: Generates detailed chapter outlines for books, including key scenes, plot progression, character arcs, and themes. Use this when planning book structure or expanding story ideas.
skill.summary: Generates detailed chapter outlines for books, including key scenes, plot progression, character arc...
skill.author: Amraha-Anwar

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill containing only Markdown instructions for generating book chapter outlines. No code execution, file access, network communication, or system capabilities are present. The skill behavior aligns perfectly with its stated purpose.

content.user_title: Generate detailed chapter outlines for books
content.value_statement: Planning a book structure can feel overwhelming. This skill generates detailed chapter outlines with key scenes, character arcs, and plot progression to help writers build compelling narratives.
actual_capabilities: Generates chapter-by-chapter outlines from story details
Organizes content using standard narrative structures (setup, rising action, climax, resolution)
Includes key events, conflicts, and character development for each chapter
Adds emotional tone, themes, foreshadowing, and transition elements
Ensures narrative continuity and logical flow between chapters
limitations: Does not write actual chapter content or prose
Requires user to provide story details (genre, plot, characters)
Outputs in Markdown list format only
Does not integrate with external writing software

use_cases.title: Plan Novel Structures
use_cases.description: Create detailed chapter outlines for novels with plot arcs, character journeys, and thematic development.

use_cases.title: Learn Story Structure
use_cases.description: Understand narrative flow by generating outlines that follow proven storytelling frameworks.

use_cases.title: Organize Book Projects
use_cases.description: Structure complex stories with multiple subplots into cohesive chapter plans before writing.

prompt_templates.title: Simple Genre Outline
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a chapter outline for a [genre] novel titled [title] about [main plot]. Include [number] chapters.

prompt_templates.title: Detailed Plot Outline
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a full chapter outline for [genre] with main plot [summary], character [list], and [number] chapters. Include key events, conflicts, and character arcs.

prompt_templates.title: Arc-Based Structure
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a chapter outline that follows the structure: Introduction, Inciting Incident, Rising Action, Midpoint Shift, Climax, Falling Action, Resolution. For [description] with [number] chapters.

prompt_templates.title: Complex Multi-Thread
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline a [number]-chapter [genre] with main plot [summary], subplots [list], and characters [list]. Show how threads interweave across chapters.

output_examples.input: Create a chapter outline for a mystery novel called The Silent Clock about a detective solving a decades-old family mystery. 12 chapters.
output: Chapter 1: The Inheritance - Detective Jane receives news of estranged uncle's death, discovers mysterious clock left as legacy
Chapter 2: First Clues - Investigation begins, hidden room discovered, old photographs reveal family secrets
Chapter 3: The Suspects - Multiple family members emerge as potential enemies, each with hidden motives
Chapter 4: The Breakthrough - Lost diary found, reveals events from 30 years ago, shifts entire investigation

best_practices: Provide comprehensive story details including plot summary, character motivations, and thematic goals
Request specific structural elements like subplots, foreshadowing, or pacing notes
Iterate on the outline by asking for revisions to refine pacing and character arcs
anti_patterns: Requesting overly complex outlines with too many subplots without clear connections
Skipping character development details and expecting compelling character arcs
Forcing rigid chapter counts without considering story needs
Ignoring thematic coherence and narrative throughlines

faq.question: Which AI platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. All major AI assistants can follow these chapter planning instructions.

faq.question: How detailed are the chapter outlines?
faq.answer: Each chapter includes title, key events, conflicts, character moments, emotional tone, themes, and transitions.

faq.question: Can I use this with existing writing software?
faq.answer: Yes. The output is plain Markdown that can be copied to Scrivener, Notion, Obsidian, or any writing app.

faq.question: Is my story data stored or shared?
faq.answer: No. This skill runs entirely within your AI conversation. No data is stored externally or shared.

faq.question: What if the outline does not match my vision?
faq.answer: Iterate. Ask for specific changes like adding more conflict, shifting pacing, or developing character arcs differently.

faq.question: Does this work for non-fiction books?
faq.answer: Yes. Adapt the prompt to include logical structure, key concepts, and learning objectives for each section.
